page.title: 19Bwlchgwyn C.P.School
page.content: The School was founded and scheduled for opening in 1874, hence the date MDCCCLXXIV incorporated in the brickwork of the building. It appears, however, that it was actually opened on June 7th 1875. When the School was opened all the pupils and adults had to speak English because all education was conducted in English. The home language of most pupils was Welsh however.Recorded in the log books are some unusual occurences including several cases of snow in June(due to the fact that the village is at 1150 feet above sea-level). The present headteacher is Mr. G.W. Jones. There are four classes which are Infants taught by the Deputy Mrs. G. Wood, 1st and 2nd year juniors taught by Mrs. J. Burke, Nursery taught by Mrs. J. Williams and 3rd and 4th year juniors taught by the Head.
